data.longtext: what i've got here is some beautiful portobello mushrooms they look great nice and large i'm just gonna remove the stems here so easy to remove just gently pull them and they'll come right off so what i'm going to do is just oil them up a little bit oil both sides yeah i'm going to give it a little bit of a season with some salt

i've got some garlic here just give it a smash one more just mince that up beautiful set that to the side so you're gonna also cut up some jalapenos here just remove the stems put down the middle just going to remove those seeds we're going to do a small dice on these another chop on them we're gonna saute up these jalapenos and garlic so as that begins to cook we're gonna also chop up these beautiful caps of our mushrooms and just coarsely chop it this is gonna get cooked down anyway inside of our pan beautiful same with our stems add your mushrooms to the pan i'm going to give it a season of salt generous season i'm gonna give it a little bit of black pepper just add a little bit more oil mushrooms are like sponges so they really do pick up anything any liquid that you put it with or any oil or fat so that looks good it's cooked down

we've got some cream cheese right here we're gonna add the cream cheese in it's softened so that it's pliable we're also going to add in our bacon and our lovely cheddar cheese i'm just gonna give that a mix so look at that really easy

we're going to divide this into thirds just kind of eyeball it stack it up really nicely here i'll actually bring this up so you guys can see so this is going to go into an oven 350 degrees preheated and it's going to cook for about 20 minutes

we're gonna pull out our mushrooms out of the oven they smell fantastic yes please i'm gonna take this one right here give us a little garnish of parsley and we're going to dig in oh yes that just gave me so much life
I've got 10 mushrooms just little cut mushrooms and all I've done is I've pulled the stalks off each one and I'm just going to brush each one over with a little bit of olive oil

In a mixing bowl I've got about a hundred grams of ricotta cheese... now I'm also adding in about a hundred grams of semi dried tomatoes which I have just chopped up into little chunks I'm adding a little bit of fresh basil which I've just chopped up roughly chopped no need to be overly neat quarter of a cup of some grated cheddar cheese 1 egg and season with some salt and some pepper and just mix that all together until it's nice and smooth

In a mixing bowl I've got about a hundred grams of ricotta cheese... now I'm also adding in about a hundred grams of semi dried tomatoes which I have just chopped up into little chunks I'm adding a little bit of fresh basil which I've just chopped up roughly chopped no need to be overly neat quarter of a cup of some grated cheddar cheese 1 egg

let's stuff our mushrooms divide the mixture between the mushrooms but what you want to do is you don't want to be actually just filling them you want to have a little bit of a mound of mixture on top of each so that way it's nice and filled like so and our stuffed mushrooms are ready to go into the oven preheated oven 180 degrees Celsius for about 20 minutes or until the mushrooms are cooked and the top is nice and golden

our stuffed mushrooms have just come out of the oven you can see some of the juices are flowing out of the mushrooms now allow them to cool for a few minutes before we serve them up because we don't want to burn anybody's mails let's have a taste
now you don't need to use ricotta cheese you could use cream cheese you could use crumble up feta pretty much any cheese you like if you like blue cheese it's really good in this

Here I've got 250 g of breadcrumbs. 500 g of finely chopped mushrooms. I actually used a food processor to chop these. 250 g of spring onions or green onions or scallions. Whatever you want to call them. A 150 g of something like either bacon or I'm using a halal salami.

Begin by melting the butter in a large pan. Once the butter is melted, add in the onions, the bacon or in my case, my salami and the garlic. Sauté gently until the onions become soft. After about 5 minutes or so, gentle sautéing, the onion should be nice and soft.

I'll just season it with a little bit of salt and pepper. Add in all the remaining ingredients: the mushrooms, the breadcrumbs and the rosemary. Give it all a good mix. When everything is nicely mixed, it's ready for use!

Start out with prepping the mushrooms. I've got some pretty big cremini mushrooms here that I just wiped off with a damp towel to get off all the dusties off and then you just wanna pop the stem out and I find the easiest way to do it it kind of like going around and break this membrane if you need to, sometimes it's not there, but I think fresher mushrooms usually have that little membrane and then just kind of pop it out.

The base of it is gonna be some cream cheese. Add a little bit of mayonnaise. And I'm gonna add one packet of Hidden Valley salad dressing and seasoning mix. Just get these mixed up together. Okay, so this looks really good. It's all smooth. So we can add the rest of our filling ingredients, so I'm gonna use a little bit of grated cheese. I'm using Monterrey Jack. I think cheddar would be really good too. Some grated carrots. Some finely chopped spinach. Some green onions and some fresh herbs. Today I'm gonna use some dill and parsley, but you could use all dill or all parsley. And then some bread crumbs. You wanna save some to put on the top of the stuffed mushrooms later and I'm gonna add some black pepper.
The base of it is gonna be some cream cheese. Add a little bit of mayonnaise.

So I'm using a baking tray that I've lined with a little bit of parchment. You don't need to do that, but it makes clean up a little bit easier. So then we can just start filling the mushrooms and I just use a regular spoon and do a teaspoon and a half or two teaspoons, depending on the size of the mushroom. Once your mushrooms are all stuffed, you just wanna sprinkle the top of each one with a couple pinches of bread crumbs. Just to make sure you get a nice little toasty brown top and add a little bit of crunch. And if you did wanna make these ahead of time, you could just refrigerate them for up to hour and then bake them whenever you're ready for some hot stuffed mushrooms. So I'm gonna put these in a preheated 400 degree oven and bake 'em for 20 to 25 minutes, until the mushrooms are nice and soft and kind of shrively and the tops are brown and toasty and everything inside is all melty and yummy and gooey.

Alright, so 20 minutes later and my house smells amazing and these look gorgeous and I can't wait to eat one. Now, let's taste this recipe. They're gonna be hot so beware. Biter beware. Ya'll really should try this. This is one of my favorite stuffed mushroom recipes that I've ever had or even ever created.
for the foundation in our stuffing I went ahead and toasted my bread cubes now I'm using equal parts whole wheat and white and I've toasted these in a really hot oven so they're super super crispy

and because this is a mushroom stuffing recipe we're gonna start off with our mushrooms so here I have some crimini mushrooms all cut up these are gonna go directly in the pan there we go and now I don't like mushrooms that are super soft and squishy so what I want to do watch how I do this I'm going to coat my mushrooms with the oil just like that in the pan and then I'm going to let them sit

I've got some chicken broth here you can use vegetable that's totally fine to it I'm going to add a couple of eggs now you don't want to do this if you're gonna stuff your turkey with this stuffing because the eggs may not cook all the way through but if you're gonna bake your stuffing it's just fine I'm using eggs as a binding agent

this is gonna go directly into our oiled baking dish I just sprayed it with a little bit of nonstick cooking spray there we go now this is going to go into the oven and you're gonna cook it for 30 minutes with foil on top and then you're gonna take the foil off and cook it for another 15 minutes so that that top gets nice and brown
now these are done I'm gonna take them off the heat and add a little sprinkle of salt just like that and a few grinds of pepper

I'm gonna deglaze with about a cup of white wine that's gonna help me get all those flavors into the vegetables and give a fabulous flavor to the stuffing if you don't want to use an alcohol like wine go ahead and use chicken stock or even water is totally fine

now what we're gonna do is we're gonna let this cool a little bit hmm and then we're gonna go inside the food processor here's the reason why because you see the sausage is chunky right big piece right and I don't uh I I didn't want to grind it ahead of time so what I do is I get all the flavor of that right and all your vegetables right whatever zap it together

start by preheating your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit while you wait prepare your mushrooms remove the stem and then remove the gills from your portobello caps with a spoon another way to prepare your mushroom is peeling off the outside skin this just makes it a little easier to cut apart after you've cooked it use a basting brush to cook the inside and outside of your mushroom caps with olive oil make sure to coat your pan as well place your mushrooms topside down in your baking dish sprinkle the inside of your mushrooms with garlic and shallots take your mushroom caps in the oven for about 10 minutes

once your butter is melted add your garlic and shallots and cook until translucent on medium heat next add your olive oil and cook until the edges of the garlic and shallots begin to brown in are crispy once your garlic and shallots are crispy go ahead and add your mushrooms and sun-dried tomatoes saute until they're sweated adding salt and pepper to taste

stuff your caps with your mushroom and greens mixture you want to align your filling up to the edge of the portobello cap if you overstuff them they will fall apart in the next step you finally top here mushrooms with mozzarella cheese we're using via vegan mozzarella shreds but any mozzarella cheese would work once you're done topping these pop them back into the oven until the cheese has melted
once your cheese has melted place on a bed of baby greens we topped ours with vegan mushroom gravy

go ahead and melt your butter in a saute pan once your butter is melted add your garlic and shallots and cook until translucent on medium heat next add your olive oil and cook until the edges of the garlic and shallots begin to brown in are crispy once your garlic and shallots are crispy go ahead and add your mushrooms and sun-dried tomatoes saute until they're sweated adding salt and pepper to taste
once your greens are nice and wilted go ahead and take this off heat
we're using via vegan mozzarella shreds but any mozzarella cheese would work

okay I've got some cremini mushrooms here and if you are if you're ever gonna do stuff in mushroom you need to be able to follow out a mushroom so on these what I like to use because they've got a nice you know kind of stem that's easy to pull out at a good area in there easiest thing to do if the stem pops out easily this one's not popping out really easily then you know sometimes they just break off you're good to go otherwise you can take a knife here and just go right around the stem I kind of actually hold it on the blade to get full control and just turn it hold the knife still turn the mushroom and you can pop that stem right out you can certainly just go right there put a little stuffing in there or you can then take a spoon and just kind of scrape out the insides and the gills out of the shroom and it's dump those right out on the on the cutting board discard them not a whole lot of use for the gills the stems you can cut off throwing the throw on your stuffing

going to start our mushroom stuffing shockingly it up with mushrooms so I've got all these stems that we pulled out just chopped up finely as well as there's a there's a couple whole mushrooms in there I just add some some extras I'm gonna add that into a sauté pan with some olive oil salt and pepper I'm just gonna cook these off over medium heat until the to the water is evaporated out of them and we've got a nice kind of nice firm texture to some mushrooms

okay I've got my stuff in here just cool it off a little bit it doesn't have to be be too cool I'm gonna and about call that it two tablespoons of breadcrumbs an equal amount of Parmesan cheese and then I'm adding some pine nuts as well

so our mushrooms have now cooled off to where I can handle them and I'm just gonna okay I'm not gonna do it over the dish I'm gonna do it over my bowl here I'm gonna fill them with my stuffing and then I've got I like to pack it in too tight keep it fairly loose and then just a little bit of Parmesan cheese on each and every one and you can lay them right back down into the into the pan that you did the first roast end and pop them back into that 400-degree oven for probably to another 15 20 minutes or so

okay if you serve it as a little hors d'oeuvres you can lay them out on a nice little plate like this you know remember there was a little bit of tarragon was the herb we use so you can always throw a little bit of green on the plate to make it look nice and pretty

one of the things I actually do is roast off my hollowed-out mushrooms before stuffing because I find them you know these can be it's a pretty big pretty big mushroom to be cooked off and say 20 minutes or 25 minutes in the oven and I find a mobile raw tasting a little kind of soft or undercooked so I pre cook mine for about 25 minutes in the oven 400 degrees

hello there guys and welcome to students do you like mushrooms I know I do today I will be making some super delicious stuffed portobello mushrooms I hope that you enjoy this episode so what you need is portobello mushrooms the amount depends on how many you will be making I'm just going to take two corn you should take about two tablespoons per portobello mushrooms so that's four tablespoons of corn the same applies for the kidney beans one small onion finely chopped about one tablespoon of sour cream some sriracha sauce demand depends on how spicy you want the recipe to be 1 clove of garlic a handful of grated mozzarella cheese and finally some chives as decoration first we're going to start off by preparing the mushrooms if your mushroom has a stem just remove it by snapping it off make sure that you don't break your portobello mushroom then take a spoon and remove these hairy bits or yeah I don't know how to call them just scrape them off a bit set them aside we're not going to be wasteful in this recipe so we're going to add this to the filling later there we go something like this

so here I have a pan with some olive oil in there now let's put it on a fire and let it get hot once the oil is hot add in your onion and let it fry for a bit once the onion starts looking blazing let's add the mushroom give it a good stir and fry this for about a minute then crushing your garlic make sure not to over fry your garlic otherwise it won't become bitter starting to smell really really nice at this point it's optional to season your mushrooms I'm just going to season them with some and a little bit of salt now let's add in the key beans and the corn and fry that for about three to four minutes
now let's add a good tablespoon of sour cream and of course it depends how spicy you want it squeeze a good amount of sriracha sauce on top let's mix everything up

take a tray covered with baking paper and place your portobello mushrooms on there then take your filling and put it in the mushrooms there we go top it off with mozzarella cheese there we go now put them into a preheated oven at 200 degrees Celsius for about five to eight minutes

and there you go about eight minutes later the mushrooms are done all we have left is to decorate them with some chives and there you go as you can see this one is falling apart a bit because the edges were not as sturdy as this one so if you're making these make sure that your portobello mushrooms have a sturdy edge and they're really firm

hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode of Laura in the kitchen I want to show you how I make my shot I call them like my creamy sausage stuffed mushrooms they are absolutely insanely good you're gonna love them and they're really great like lower like a low carb option for your Easter table I've been getting a lot of messages on Instagram to share just a couple of like low carb options for your Easter menu so I feel this would be really great and you can make them into an entree if you want to by just using bigger mushrooms like a portobello mushroom and that would be fantastic but these are gonna be great with a little bit of arugula and fennel salad for either an entree a side dish a starter whatever you fancy let me when you're through the list of in Greensborough beg you need some mushrooms these are just white button mushrooms that I prepped and I'll show you one in just a second I've got a four blend cheese here mozzarella Asiago provolone and lots of freshly grated parm these are the stems from those mushrooms that I just finely chopped onion garlic parsley a little cream cheese Italian sausage salt and a little bit of olive oil now I'm gonna show you how I prepped the mushrooms just to give you an idea of how I did all of them so I just take out the stem and you take the stem and you give it a nice little chopper Roux because this is perfectly edible it's not too hard it's not too tough it's perfect and just take a little teeny tiny teaspoon right and this doesn't have to be pretty because these are gonna be covered so you won't see it but I kind of just get rid of all the center bits so I've got a nice amount of surface area here for the stuffing and that's it I just kind of took a damp paper towel to clean each one and they're good to go

to myhouse skillet with a little bit of olive oil I'm gonna add my sausage now I bought my sausage already in book like this out of the casing but if you were using like sausage links do you want to get rid of the casing now I know for a fact that I'm gonna have a lot more filling than I do mushrooms that's because I'm saving some of it to make stuffed mushrooms in the middle of the week I need it twice Omega one huh so that's what I'm doing it so I'm just gonna cook in my skillet over about medium heat medium-high ish heat until the sausage is pretty much fully cooked and you want to break it up as much as you can with a wooden spoon this looks really great now obviously it's not fully cooked through yet but that's okay because it's got a ways to go so now I'm gonna add my diced onion finely chopped onion 1 small 1/2 medium large joy charge you do and the stems of mushrooms right so now to this I'm gonna add a good pinch of salt and cook them all together I'm not gonna add any extra oil or anything just because a sausage already is rendering a little bit of fat and the sausage i buy is quite lean I mean as you can see there's not like a kind of fat rendering but it's just enough that's going to cook everything really nicely that's gonna be so delicious you gotta trust me on this they're really simple and easy but what a fantastic recipe to serve in the middle of the night I mean I like to do these to be honest appetizer side sides are fantastic but I love to do these and really big portobello mushrooms with a lovely side salad perfect weeknight dinner that it's so satisfying and if you are curbing your carbs a couple times a week because if you don't even like me you eat heavy carbs a few times and low carb is a few times it's called balanced then this is so great you're gonna love it so you're gonna keep my eye on this and just cook it until the sauce is develop some color and the mushrooms and onions cook down this looks really great so now I'm gonna just add the garlic add that right in and the parsley I'm just gonna cook this for I don't know like a minute just to kind of cook the garlic a little bit and then I'm gonna add it all to a big bowl and then we'll continue on to make the filling

alright this looks amazing to me I mean do it it mmm super yummy now I'm gonna add my cream cheese sounds crazy I know but it is amazingly delicious and it kind of it kind of holds everything together without having to add and the eggs or bread crumbs but it also gives you this lovely creamy component that makes these melt in your Boca mmm so good so I'm just gonna work the cream cheese in the hot sausage mixture just I'm gonna use my spoon because it's nice and easy

and now what I've done here so I've done my I'll been preheated to 400 degrees right now because I made the filling in my cast-iron skillet and my cast-iron skillet can go right into my oven what I did was I just added a small drizzle of olive oil to the same skillet I don't even rinse it out because more flavor and more better I'm gonna just cook them in there I mean why get everything else something else dirty if I don't need to right and it's gonna be delicious when it's soaked up the mushrooms are gonna soak up any extra flavor from the bottom of the pan so it's a two-for-one really and we're just about near the end of where we want to be with this mixin so here's what you do now you take your mushroom okay this is a lot of flavor so I don't have to season this at all all right take an ice cream scoop a small one and I do a little bit of that and then go right into your pan and then just continue that's all son look at this look at this I mean honestly now you just take a little bit of your cheese a lot of cheese a lot of is better and then I just found it on each one now I'm gonna pop these into my oven at 400 come on 15 20 minutes or so until golden brown I'll show you what they look like when they are done

all right these were in the oven for 15 minutes at 400 look at this look at this gorgeous bronze to cap the bottom is just lovely and juicy the interior you can see is super cheesy I mean I'm into this okay I am all about it probably should have gotten the spoon but you know it's okay I'm just gonna taste one for now and half the rest for dinner I'm gonna use this so I don't have a smaller knife near me right now look at that look at this cap is beautiful this I mean it's just magnificent I just kind of pulled it apart for you to see the interior but it holds together really well smells unbelievable give me a second up this is gonna be really hot I literally just pulled it out of the oven best stuffed mushrooms will ever have in your entire life they are so delicious they are so creamy so see away from the cheese and the cream cheese just really brings them together and make some super super creamy you know I'm just gonna do this mmm robbing on just do it Laura in the kitchen that come has a written recipe for you right there to die for make them for you holiday table I hope you enjoyed my time with me

hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode of Laura in the kitchen I want to show you how I make my shot I call them like my creamy sausage stuffed mushrooms they are absolutely insanely good you're gonna love them and they're really great like lower like a low carb option for your Easter table I've been getting a lot of messages on Instagram to share just a couple of like low carb options for your Easter menu so I feel this would be really great and you can make them into an entree if you want to by just using bigger mushrooms like a portobello mushroom and that would be fantastic but these are gonna be great with a little bit of arugula and fennel salad for either an entree a side dish a starter whatever you fancy

the first step of this is to prepare the bread uh you want a loaf that's fairly dense not like a cake loaf don't use like a Wonder Bread or something like that it has to be like real bread um it can be stale but it really won't make any difference here cuz we're going to bake it anyway so if you've got stale use stale if you all you can get is fresh find use fresh um now you're going to cut this up into cubes

I'm going to let this sit and absorb all this liquid I don't want to add the egg because first of all it'll start spoilage and second of all it will actually interfere with the absorption of the the liquid by the bread so we're just going to mix this around and let it stand after you're satisfied that it's mixed as well as you can put some cing film over it let it stand for a while go on after about half an hour we remove the clean film I've got the um one whole egg and the egg yolk this up little first sure it breaks up and I'm also going to put a little fresh ground white pepper on this too remember it's had no pepper added so far

okay put the mixture in here sure you get everything smooth it out now for the first period of cooking I'm going to cover it with foil this will make sure that the bread doesn't end up drying up and and turning chewy which is something you want to make very sure to avoid cuz nobody likes chewy stuffing okay it's going the oven for the first period it's been 30 minutes now remove the cover and it goes back in for the remaining time

and now after the last 10 minutes uh I'm going to do is I'm going to put this cover back on it in order to retain some of that moisture so it doesn't all evaporate out now so we want it want the stuffing to be moist just let it sit like this till it cools down

now we're going to begin making the uh liquid that goes over the top of this bread I'm going to put in cut up red bell peppers I took the garlic cloves and I just sliced them in off um I'm going to add some dried rosemary to this uh this is one of those instances where I'm actually I don't want the high notes of the herb which is why I'm putting that in now I just want that this background deep richness is all we're going for now um with the paprika and we'll put a little bit of salt we're going to we're going to adjust the seasoning later but is salted all the way through so that you don't end up in the end with bread has no saltiness to it at all in within the stuffing okay there's the olive oil now this gets uh usual stick blender treatment

I've preheated the oven to 150 c as soon as it goes in I'm going to lower the temperature and turn the fan on you can play around with these proportions you know up and down these are the ones I'm comfortable with because I've made it many many times
